editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: Asmat prayers, arranged for the days of the week: Monday (1r), Tuesday (10r), Wednesday (17v), Thursday (26r), Friday (30v), Saturday (34v), Sunday (38v), and Anaphora of Our Lady Mary (f-60v). Ff: Asmat prayer of Saint Qoporyanos for protection from Satan and from the evil eye. Ff includes an asmat prayer based on the Hebrew letters. Ff. contains an asmat prayer written by the prophet Jeremiah. Ff: an asmat prayer which God gave to the three Hebrew children. Ff includes the Anaphora of Saint Mary. lluminations: ii v-iii r: The Annunciation. Caption: "How Gabrial made the announcement while Mary was spinning gold and fiber." Notes: F. i r, left: Note of ownership by መምሬ (scholar) አክሊሉ. F. i r, right: Asmat prayer written in an abbreviated manner to keep its contents secret. and passim mention the owner, ገብረ ማርያም. F and 46v refer to Abba Yosef (= John XVIII, bishop of Alexandria 1769 - 1796, birthname Joseph), and Iyosab (= Yosab II, Patriarch of Ethiopia 1770-1803). But the paleography does not appear to be older than the mid to late 19th century.
